project.name: silog
project.description: A very simple Node.js logging utility, useful especially during development

silog.name: silog
silog.description: Revealing module for silog; exposes the required public members.

Logger.name: Logger
Logger.description: Constructor of the main class responsible for the logging logic.

params.name: p
params.description:
configuration parameters, as follows (if not specified
                  by the user, defaults will be used):
                  * level: one of the elements of silog().LEVEL; only
                  messages above it will be logged; default = LEVEL.INFO
                  * tsFormat: one of the elements of silog().DT_FORMAT;
                  specifies how the date and time should be logged;
                  default = DT_FORMAT.DATE_TIME
                  * loggers: array of functions that should be used for
                  writing the logged messages to output; the signature of
                  these functions should be
                  "function write(message, extra)" where message is the
                  message to be written and extra an Object with extra
                  information; by default, a standard output logger is
                  used

return.description:
an instance of the Logger if the instantiation was
                  successful, null otherwise.

classitems.description:

The logging levels used by silog; an order relation is established
between them, with ASSERT (7) being the highest and VERBOSE (2) the
lowest. If silog's level is set to X, any message with the level Y < X
will not be logged.
classitems.name: LEVEL

classitems.description: The date/ time format used in the logged messages.
classitems.name: DT_FORMAT

classitems.description: The tag used for logging internal messages.
classitems.name: LOCAL_TAG

classitems.description:
Checks if the given parameter is a valid silog logging level i.e. is an
array of size 2, with the first element a number and the second one a
string. Moreover, if the second parameter evaluates to true, the
existence of the array in silog.LEVEL will be checked.
classitems.name: checkLevel

params.name: exists
params.description:
if true, the existence of the object in
                               silog.LEVEL will be checked.

return.description:
true if the object is a valid logging level,
                         false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Adds a leading zero to numbers lower than 10 (e.g., 6 becomes 06, 11
remains as is).
classitems.name: leadingZero

return.description: the number with the leading zero added (if necessary).

classitems.description:
Returns the current time along with a formatted string in the specified
form (see silog.DT_FORMAT)
classitems.name: getFormattedTimestamp

params.name: format
params.description:
the format in which the current date/ time should
                        be returned.

return.description:
the formatted date/ time along with the original
                        timestamp.

classitems.description: Simple logger that outputs the messages to the standard output.
classitems.name: consoleLogger

classitems.description: Send a given messages to the various loggers.
classitems.name: log

classitems.description: Logs a message with the silog.LEVEL.ASSERT level.
Logs a message with the silog.LEVEL.ERROR level.
Logs a message with the silog.LEVEL.WARN level.
Logs a message with the silog.LEVEL.INFO level.
Logs a message with the silog.LEVEL.DEBUG level.
Logs a message with the silog.LEVEL.VERBOSE level.
